title: Baharin Hamidon
text:
<a href="Corporal">Corporal</a> Mohammad Baharin bin Hamidon (born 8 November 1987) is a <a href="Brunei">Brunei</a>an international <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays for Bruneian <a href="Brunei%20Super%20League">league</a> champions <a href="MS%20ABDB">MS ABDB</a> and the <a href="Brunei%20national%20football%20team">Brunei national team</a> as a <a href="Midfielder%20%28association%20football%29">midfielder</a>.
Club career.
Since 2008, Baharin has been playing at the highest division in <a href="Football%20in%20Brunei">Bruneian football</a> for the football team of the <a href="Royal%20Brunei%20Armed%20Forces">Royal Brunei Armed Forces</a>' sports club, <a href="MS%20ABDB">MS ABDB</a>. He has won four league titles, six <a href="Brunei%20FA%20Cup">FA Cups</a> and two <a href="Brunei%20Super%20Cup">Super Cups</a> with the Armymen. Baharin scored in the final of the 2014–15 FA Cup and repeated his feat in 2016.
International career.
Due to consistent performances with his club, Baharin was selected to play for the <a href="Brunei%20national%20football%20team">Wasps</a> at the <a href="2016%20AFC%20Solidarity%20Cup">2016 AFC Solidarity Cup</a> held in <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>, having been on standby for the <a href="2016%20AFF%20Suzuki%20Cup%20qualification">2016 AFF Suzuki Cup qualifying</a> matches. He made two substitute appearances in <a href="Kuching">Kuching</a>, the first in a 4–0 win over <a href="Timor-Leste%20national%20football%20team">Timor-Leste</a> on 2 November.
